src.writer.BopWriter module¶

class src.writer.BopWriter.BopWriter(config)[source]¶

Bases: src.writer.WriterInterface.WriterInterface

Saves the synthesized dataset in the BOP format. The dataset is split
into chunks which are saved as individual “scenes”. For more details about the BOP format, visit the BOP toolkit docs: https://github.com/thodan/bop_toolkit/blob/master/docs/bop_datasets_format.md

Attributes per object:

Keyword Description
dataset Annotations for objects of this dataset will be saved. Type: string.
append_to_existing_output If true, the new frames will be appended to the existing ones.
Type: bool. Default: False  
ignore_dist_thres Distance in meters between camera and object after which it is ignored. Mostly due to
failed physics. Type: float. Default: 5.

Stores frames and annotations for objects from the specified dataset.

src.writer.BopWriter.load_json(path, keys_to_int=False)[source]¶

Loads content of a JSON file. From the BOP toolkit (https://github.com/thodan/bop_toolkit).

Parameters:path – Path to the JSON file.
Returns:Content of the loaded JSON file.
src.writer.BopWriter.save_depth(path, im)[source]¶

Saves a depth image (16-bit) to a PNG file. From the BOP toolkit (https://github.com/thodan/bop_toolkit).

Parameters:
  • path – Path to the output depth image file.
  • im – ndarray with the depth image to save.
src.writer.BopWriter.save_json(path, content)[source]¶

Saves the content to a JSON file in a human-friendly format. From the BOP toolkit (https://github.com/thodan/bop_toolkit).

Parameters:
  • path – Path to the output JSON file.
  • content – Dictionary/list to save.
